org.xlattice.transport.tls

Class AsyncTlsServerConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.transport.tls.AsyncTlsConnection
      • org.xlattice.transport.tls.AsyncTlsServerConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.xlattice.crypto.tls.TlsConst, AsyncPacketConnection, ConnectionListener

    public class AsyncTlsServerConnection
extends AsyncTlsConnection
    Bear in mind that the TCP server end of a connection need not be the TLS server end - it may be a TLS client - although it may be a useful simplification to require that the TCP server end also be the TLS server end.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

    • Method Detail

      • isClient

        public final boolean isClient()
        Specified by:
        isClient in class AsyncTlsConnection

      • setConnection

        public void setConnection(SchedulableConnection cnx,
                          java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Tells the listener what connection it is listening to and what input buffer the connection is using. IOScheduler and SelectionKey are available from the connection. This method should be called once and only once. This is a TLS server connection, so it will result in an initiateReading() call on the connection.
        Parameters:
        cnx - reporting SchedulableConnection
        buffer - input data buffer
